These well-preserved museums in Bangalore reflect the perfect blend of royal history, art and culture of Bangalor (Read More)e. Here is the list of 12 12 Magnificent Museums in Bangalore for History Enthusiasts 1. Jawaharlal Nehru Planetarium, Bangalore 4.2 /5 The Jawaharlal Nehru Planetarium in Bangalore is a popular destination for astronomy enthusiasts, offering a captivating journey through the cosmos with its state-of-the-art dome-shaped theater. Named after India's first Prime Minister, Jawaharlal Nehru, the planetarium hosts engaging sky shows and educational programs, providing visitors with a fascinating glimpse into the wonders of the universe.Location: Sri T. Chowdaiah Road, High Grounds, Bengaluru, Karnataka, India.Timings: 10:30 AM to 5:30 PM on weekdays and from 10:30 AM to 7:30 PM on weekends.Entry Fee: INR 30 to INR 60 for adults and INR 15 to INR 30 for children Read More 2. HAL Aerospace Museum, Bangalore 4.1 /5 View 12+ photos The HAL Aerospace Museum in Bangalore is a fascinating institution that showcases the rich history and evolution of aviation in India, particularly the contributions of Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL). With an impressive display of aircraft, engines, and aerospace technologies, visitors can explore the milestones of Indian aviation and gain insights into the country's aeronautical achievements. Location: Old Airport Road, near HAL Police Station, Hindustan Aeronautics Limited, Marathahalli, Bangalore, Karnataka, India.Timings: 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM on all days of the week, except for Mondays and second Tuesdays.Entry Fee: adults is Rs. 50;  children (3-12 years) is Rs. 30;  There might be special rates for students and group bookings. Read More 3. Visvesvaraya Industrial and Technological Museum, Bangalore 4.3 /5 The Visvesvaraya Industrial and Technological Museum in Bangalore showcases the rich heritage of India's industrial and technological advancements. Named after Sir M. Visvesvaraya, a renowned engineer, the museum offers an engaging experience through interactive exhibits, scientific demonstrations, and informative displays, making it a popular destination for both students and enthusiasts interested in science and technology.Location: Kasturba Road, Bangalore, Karnataka, India.Timings: Tuesday to Sunday: 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM, Closed on Mondays and national holidays.Entry Fee: Adults: INR 50; Children (3-12 years): INR 30; Students (with ID): INR 30; Senior Citizens (60 years and above): INR 30 Read More 4. Janapada Loka Museum 3.6 /5 View 12+ photos Janapada Loka Museum in Bangalore showcases a rich collection of artifacts representing the diverse folk traditions and cultural heritage of Karnataka. The museum provides a comprehensive insight into the state's traditional arts, crafts, and lifestyle through exhibits such as folk instruments, costumes, and ritualistic objects. Location: Janapada Loka Museum is situated in Ramanagara, approximately 53 kilometers from Bangalore city.Timings:  9:00 AM to 5:30 PM on all days of the week.Entry Fee:  INR 20 for adults and INR 10 for children. National Gallery Of Modern Art 4.4 /5 The National Gallery of Modern Art (NGMA) in Bangalore is a cultural hub that showcases an extensive collection of modern and contemporary Indian art, providing a platform for artists to express their creativity. With a diverse range of paintings, sculptures, and installations, the gallery offers a glimpse into the evolution of Indian art over the years. Location: Manikyavelu Mansion, 49 Palace Road, Bengaluru, Karnataka, India.Timings: 11:00 AM to 6:30 PM, Tuesday to Sunday. It is closed on Mondays and national holidays.Entry Fee:  INR 20 for Indian citizens and INR 500 for foreign nationals. Students and senior citizens may have discounted rates or free entry on specific days.  Read More 6. Government Museum The Government Museum in Bangalore, also known as the Karnataka State Museum, is a cultural treasure trove that showcases a diverse collection of artifacts and exhibits. With a rich display of archaeological finds, ancient sculptures, traditional crafts, and historical artifacts, the museum offers visitors a fascinating journey through the region's history and heritage. Location: Kasturba Road, Bangalore, Karnataka, IndiaTimings: 10:00 AM to 5:00 PM (Closed on Wednesdays and public holidays)Entry Fee:Indian Nationals: INR 20 (Adults), INR 10 (Children); Foreign Nationals: INR 200 (Adults), INR 100 (Children); Free entry for school children on educational tours 7. Gandhi Bhavana Gandhi Bhavana is a significant institution dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi, the father of the Indian nation, situated in Bangalore, India. It serves as a memorial and research center, promoting the principles and teachings of Gandhiji for the public. The facility houses a museum, library, and archives, offering visitors a comprehensive understanding of Gandhi's life and philosophy.Location: Gandhi Bhavana is located in Kumara Park East, Sheshadripuram, Bangalore, India.Timings: 10:00 AM to 5:00 PM, Monday to Saturday. It may be closed on public holidays. 8. NIMHANS Brain Museum The NIMHANS Brain Museum, located in Bangalore, India, is a unique institution dedicated to the study and display of the human brain. It houses a fascinating collection of over 600 brain specimens, providing valuable insights into neurological disorders and brain anatomy. Visitors can explore the museum to gain a deeper understanding of the complexities of the human brain and its various functions.Location:  National Institute of Mental Health and Neurosciences (NIMHANS) campus in Bangalore, Karnataka, India.Timings: weekdays from 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM. 9. Karnataka Chitrakala Parishath Karnataka Chitrakala Parishath is a renowned art institution and cultural organization located in Bangalore, India, dedicated to the promotion and preservation of visual arts. The institution houses an impressive collection of contemporary and traditional Indian art, showcasing the talents of both emerging and established artists. Location: Art Complex, Kumara Krupa Road, near Shivananda Circle.Timings: 10:00 AM to 7:00 PM on all days, except Sundays and public holidays.Entry Fee: varies depending on exhibitions and events. 10. Museum of Art & Photography (MAP) The Museum of Art & Photography (MAP) is a vibrant cultural institution that showcases a diverse collection of art and photography, spanning various periods and styles. From classical masterpieces to contemporary works, MAP offers a rich and immersive experience for art enthusiasts, providing a platform for both established and emerging artists.Location: Kasturba Rd, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001Timings: 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM, Tuesday through Sunday. The museum is closed on Mondays.Entry Fee: General Admission: INR 200; Students (with valid ID): INR 100; Children under 12: Free admission 11. Indian Music Experience Museum The Indian Music Experience Museum is a captivating institution dedicated to the rich and diverse tapestry of Indian music. It offers a unique and immersive journey through the history, evolution, and cultural significance of various musical genres in India, showcasing a vast collection of instruments, artifacts, and interactive exhibits.Address: Brigade Millennium, J.P. Nagar 7th Phase, Bengaluru, Karnataka, India.Timings: 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM.  Tuesday to Sunday.Entry Fee:Adults: INR 300; Children (3-12 years): INR 150; Students and Senior Citizens: INR 200; Children below 3 years: Free entry. 12. SANDESHA - Museum of Communication SANDESHA - Museum of Communication is a unique institution dedicated to preserving the history and evolution of communication technologies. With interactive exhibits showcasing the journey from ancient forms of communication to modern technologies, visitors can explore the fascinating world of telecommunication, postal services, and digital communication. Address: 14, Museum Rd, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560025Timings: 10:00 am - 4:00 pm, closed on sundays. Entry fee: Free entry Next time, when you plan a trip, do visit these beautiful museums in Bangalore.
